channel.title: Help getting moparclassic online
channel.description:
hopefully someone can help me to get this Online.
im wondering how the auths work.. like if you use persistence auth how do you get it to work? i know it just checks a database or storage to make sure credentials are correct, but it seems to be my issue. If you could help me out id appreciate it thanks.

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:27, topic:518143”][quote author=matty matt link=topic=636406.msg4291413#msg4291413 date=1367323687]

Why are you trying to link forums to in-game accounts?

how else can you make it so people can create an account to play in game??
[/quote]Are you seriously asking me that? How about you actually use your brain for once…[/quote]
i dont know how… how would you make it able to use client to create an account… could you still use any storage?

EDIT: how would you make it so people can create an account via client, but it checks credentials using serializedstorage.

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @Snemo Snemo
item.description:
@Snemo wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:10, topic:518143”]DummyAuth just accepts everything, no matter what. That is, the password doesn’t matter.

PersistenceAuth uses the StorageMedium to check the passwords.

WebsiteAuth uses a web page to check the password. To get this working properly, you need to create a page that does this.

[hr]

DummyStorageMedium doesn’t save anything and just gives you a brand new character each login.

The MySQL storage medium uses MySQL to save/load.

SerializedStorageMedium just uses the serialization API to save/load.

[hr]

Also, just saying that you’re having trouble with something is completely worthless. Explain what’s going wrong, in detail.[/quote]

Your so awesome, i just want to sniff your butt.

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

matty matt:

i have. I get the username and password added in the game and website database, but still have error invalid username or pass when i try to log into the client

Lmao with the stringToLong function I just gave you. Put that in your forums registration php form. All you have to do is make user = stringToLong(requestedUsername)

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

tigerclan:

That is because you have to change the username to a long and put it in the database under the “user” column. And you set “username” and “owner_username” to the text version of the username and set “pass” to an md5 hash of the requested password

i have it in the user column, what do you mean change it to a long-- how do you do that?

fluxxbb must be different because my register.php i have does not use functions…

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:15, topic:518143”]no theres a method in the server/client that converts strings to longs(big numbers, not hashes).

here ill give you the method, since it was given to me as well

[code]
function stringToLong($char) {
$char = strtolower($char);
$hash = 0;
for ( $i = 0; $i < strlen($char); $i++ ) {
$c = ord($char[$i]);
$hash = bcmul($hash, 37);
if ( $c >= 97 && $c <= 122 )
$hash = bcadd($hash, (1 + $c) - 97);
else if ( $c >= 48 && $c <= 57 )
$hash = bcadd($hash, (27 + $c) - 48);
}

                    $split_decimal = @explode('.', $hash);
                    return is_array($split_decimal) ? $split_decimal[0] : $hash;

}
[/code][/quote]
and you just pop this in data conversions and it will make it all work?

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

no theres a method in the server/client that converts strings to longs(big numbers, not hashes).

here ill give you the method, since it was given to me as well

function stringToLong($char) {
                        $char = strtolower($char);
                        $hash = 0;
                        for ( $i = 0; $i < strlen($char); $i++ ) {
                                $c = ord($char[$i]);
                                $hash = bcmul($hash, 37);
                                if ( $c >= 97 && $c <= 122 ) 
                                        $hash = bcadd($hash, (1 + $c) - 97);
                                else if ( $c >= 48 && $c <= 57 ) 
                                        $hash = bcadd($hash, (27 + $c) - 48);
                        }
                                                
                        $split_decimal = @explode('.', $hash);
                        return is_array($split_decimal) ? $split_decimal[0] : $hash;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

i have a register that puts the username and pass into the database. The pass is md5, how do you set the field “user” in your db to a long version of the username? so you just hash the username with md5 and insert it into user on the database…

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting moparclassic online
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“matty matt, post:12, topic:518143”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=636406.msg4290783#msg4290783 date=1367177958]
DummyAuth just accepts everything, no matter what. That is, the password doesn’t matter.

PersistenceAuth uses the StorageMedium to check the passwords.

WebsiteAuth uses a web page to check the password. To get this working properly, you need to create a page that does this.

[hr]

DummyStorageMedium doesn’t save anything and just gives you a brand new character each login.

The MySQL storage medium uses MySQL to save/load.

SerializedStorageMedium just uses the serialization API to save/load.

[hr]

Also, just saying that you’re having trouble with something is completely worthless. Explain what’s going wrong, in detail.
[/quote]

Thank you for your reply CFF, I have set mysql up and set the login server up and it connects to the game server then when i try to log in the client it says invalid username or password. There is something else i have to do to get it to work any ideas?[/quote]

you have to set up a way to register accounts and put their information into the database. just for a heads up you have to set the field “user” in your db to a long version of the username, and the password hashed to md5

Read full topic

PersistenceAuth uses the StorageMedium to check the passwords.

WebsiteAuth uses a web page to check the password. To get this working properly, you need to create a page that does this.

[hr]

DummyStorageMedium doesn’t save anything and just gives you a brand new character each login.

The MySQL storage medium uses MySQL to save/load.

SerializedStorageMedium just uses the serialization API to save/load.

[hr]

Also, just saying that you’re having trouble with something is completely worthless. Explain what’s going wrong, in detail.[/quote]

Thank you for your reply CFF, I have set mysql up and set the login server up and it connects to the game server then when i try to log in the client it says invalid username or password. There is something else i have to do to get it to work any ideas?

Read full topic
